title: OZ begins search for Prominent leader | Business News | Business and Finance News | |
text:
OZ Minerals has started an external search to find a permanent leader for its Prominent Hill copper-gold mine with the exit of a key executive.
The SA-based miner announced general manager Brian Kilgariff had resigned to take on a new role outside of OZ Minerals after nine years with the group.
Consultant Bob Fulker who has been with OZ since June this year has been appointed to lead the operation “to assist OZ Minerals in delivering the next step of the new strategy, and earn the right to grow.”
Managing director Andrew Cole said Mr Fulker has assisted the company with optimising the operations, providing technical support to corporate development and assisting in the refinement of the Carrapateena business case.
OZ Minerals (Frame content direct link: http://markets.theaustralian.com.au/embed/OZL/640 .) “His strong focus on driving down costs whilst developing a world-class safety culture across our entire business is an important step in the OZ Minerals growth story and will allow the business to take the next steps.”
Mr Fulker is a mining engineer with nearly three decades of leadership experience across BHP Billiton, Xstrata, Discovery Metals and other mining companies.
“Brian played a key leadership role during the development, construction and ongoing operation of Prominent Hill,” said managing director Andrew Cole.
He thanked Mr Kilgariff for “building a great operation and fostering strong relationships with the many stakeholders both near Prominent Hill and within the greater South Australia,” he said.
“An external search has commenced to find a suitable person to permanently lead Prominent Hill in the longer term.”
Shares were trading 1.5 per cent higher at $3.95 in early trading.
